description: The trade chief-designate of the European Union pledged tough action on China’s overcapacity exports. description: There have been cases of dramatically inflated death tolls being reported, then rolled back, but only after the much higher number had spread through the press.

description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said this week that smuggling humans should be viewed as a 'global security threat similar to terrorism.'

description: An Ontario judge says any outstanding issues regarding a proposed $32.5 billion settlement between three major tobacco companies and their creditors should be solvable in the coming months. description: Foreign Affairs Minister Mélanie Joly defended the government’s purchase of a $9 million apartment for Canada’s consul general in New York, rejecting accusations from Tory MPs that her office was involved in a “cover-up” of his involvement in the decision. description: B.C.’s chief electoral officer Anton Boegman said a missing ballot box of 861 votes that were not counted in the recent provincial election was the result of a local team’s oversight.  The ballot box was used in advance voting polls in the electoral district of Prince George-McKenzie, Boegman said at a Nov. 5 news conference. description: Keeping voicemails short, activating multi-factor authentication whenever possible, and setting up account alerts are some of the top tips to help avoid financial fraud, especially those associated with artificial intelligence (AI), according to banking experts. description: The Bank of Canada considered cutting its key interest rate by just a quarter of a percentage point last month, but opted to take a larger step in the face of a weakening economy and falling inflation. description: A federal immigration program allowing employers to hire temporary foreign workers does not have a mechanism to systemically assess the program’s impact on the Canadian labour market, according to an internal government report.
